Summary: Booked on line. Got there and the room smelled. It was disgusting. Did not take any thing in room. There were brown things in the bed when I checked it. The guy behind the desk would not give me back my money. To Expidia I stayed there after I turned in the keys to him by 10pm. Be careful!!

Well sunshine ✅ beach ✅ room that is colorful and inviting ummmmmm not so much! This is equivalent to a highway hotel 6! Too many nasty people ruin a good place cause this place could and maybe in the past was a gold mine, but needs gutting and complete redo!

This is my second time here, and again, I wasn't disappointed. It's the Holiday Season and I had business in San Clemente and came back to this cozy joint. It's an older motel, but well maintained and each room is decorated with a theme. I booked on short notice and was given a great price considering I was near the beach. What I love most about this place is the service I have received both times I have stayed here, that alone will keep me coming back. So, if your looking for a clean and cozy joint, this the place.

Summary Heading: Dog Friendly.... Well not really. Maybe if you have a small or mini dog.
Summary: I booked online through a travel website.  Booked the room with a queen bed and a twin bed. Upon arrival I was asked if I had pets. I said yes. How many... 2. Its 25.00 per pet per day. so one day is 50.00 for both animals. Non Refundable. You only have one room choice, its a small room with a queen bed. That's the pet room. The room was very small and has been remolded slightly but you can see how dated it is. Loud right next to the street. Zero places for animals to go potty. (Hint- if you have a small dog you could probably go in a small plant area. For larger dogs, walk down the street to the Travelodge and there is a small vacant lot next door. Approx. 1300 feet 400 meters down the street. PRO- Great restaurant right down the street for easy dinner or lunch. OC tavern.
Room tip: Rooms with pets only get a queen size bed, right next to the road. Very loud.

Summary: Do not and I repeat, do not book here.  It is the most disgusting place I have ever seen.  It was so filthy and smelt like pee.  The Wall was covered in god knows what.  The bed and pillows are rock hard.  The amount of dirt and dust in the covers and blinds were shocking.    I was so scared to stay there that my boyfriend and I booked into the Volare.  Early the next morning at 7, we drove over there to hand in the key and get a refund for at least one nights stay.  I was promised a refund but it never happened.  My skin crawls just to think how disgusting that motel is.  Perhaps a complete makeover is in order.  Burn the beds, pillows, and bedding.  Disgusted beyound belief.

To be honest, I was expecting the typical old motel where everything is outdated and doesn't work. Well, I was totally wrong and surprised to find the opposite. I booked on short notice for Memorial Day weekend, my first choice was San Diego but booking a reasonable room rate was impossible. I read mixed reviews about this place but I found the staff helpful and nice. I brought my lady friend and she is a skeptic. She immediately loved the place and gave me the thumbs-up approval. My room was nicely decorated and most of all, clean! The bed was comfortable and lady friend had no complaints. My room had a fridge but no microwave. However, a microwave and coffee maker is available in the courtyard area. Although located on a busy street and close to the freeway, it was

I booked 2 days (Friday and Saturday) based on their online pictures and ok ratings. Upon arrival and seeing the wrecked cars in the parking lot, tiny room, and the broken washing machine outside my rooms window I tried to cancel my stay. Unfortunately i could only cancel the saturday and I would have to pay for friday whether I stayed there or not. So my girlfriend and I cancelled Saturday night and stayed Friday. We got our room (#11) and looked it over....it was the filthiest hotel room I've ever been in! Dried blood, grime, and dead bugs in the window sills. Screens duct taped to patch tears, pubic hairs on the stained towels, floors that turned white socks black, no overhead lighting just lamps that didn't illuminate the room, the power went out an hour before checkout,

The service was awesome, the people who run the property were so friendly and helpful!! We originally stayed here on a Groupon, but have stayed no less than 5 times!!! The value is awesome, the part of town its in is cool, walking distance to 7-11 and Pipes for breakfast!

My expectations were set inappropriately as I was led to believe that a major sports company like NIKE who was a local surf sponsor gave the motel money to refresh their look.  Our rooms were absolute dumps!  Guess what, we’re the idiots as what did we think we were getting for $68 per night?!  The owner and his friends took over the central gazebo area as that was the only place to smoke- they sat there non stop, smoking and partying.  Checking in was also quite an experience, very fast and efficient until they received payment.....then slow as snails to give us the room keys!  Never will stay there again.

We booked a night here for a festival we were attending nearby. Arrived early and asked if we could possibly check in early. They said sure just give us an EXTRA $30. I said that is crazy what if we got here at 2pm. He said the price would be $30 to check in! He kept telling me the extra fees are clearly noted on the booking websites. Ive stayed at almost every level of hotel motel from Motel 6 to Marriots and Hiltons. NONE of these hotels charge early check in if a room is available. I was forced to agree because we wouldn't be able to check in until after the festival since they don't allow check in after 10pm, which is another crazy negative about this scam motel.  After agreeing to the fee I went to the room and looked up their policy on Booking website and it said they

I was looking for having a night close to Dana Point (but less expensive), I've found that hotel in San Clemente, which seemed to be a plesant place and San Clemente was but not the Inn at Calafia Beach ! 1st : the reception is pretty cold. 2nd : we've had the room #15 and the decoration is weird, it doesn't look like you are in a motel close to the beach ! It's only black and white with some red details, there's a tree with ravens (?) on it, painted on a wall and some arabesques on the others. I've found it very dark ! 3rd : even the bedroom was comfortable and spacious, the bathroom was a little bit small and...not clean (especially the shower). Not a good stay !

Got a room that we booked weeks previous for $110.  We arrived and the motel was empty besides the two of us.  We got there around 1pm and their check in is 3.  No problem.  Can we leave our bags?  No.  That day we saw that there was a cheaper rate online for $80.  After they put us in the crappiest rm they have I asked if we could pay $100.  I showed him the deal online.  No.  Ok, rm sucked and u get what u pay for.  Got it but dont u think saying yes and letting us save a whopping  $10 is worth a better review and rating.  Their hospitality and customer service needs improvement.
Manager Response: As mentioned on all travel websites, our check-in time is 3:00pm. We offered you an early check-in for you & your luggage at an additional charge but it was declined. The $80 rate you saw was for future dates for a minimum 7 day stay.

Summary Heading: Worth what you pay, great service
Summary: I've stayed here a few times with my boyfriend. The owners are very nice and accommodating - the man helped us figure out how to set up a gaming system on a TV in the room.   The rooms were clean and pretty spacious (we stayed in a cheaper room). The only advice I have is to ask for a room other than room 1, since it's pretty close to the road - although we stayed in this room and we didn't think it was very loud, plus they let you know about it and offer you earplugs.   You have a mini fridge and microwave staying here, I would definitely recommend this over the other hotels on the same street price-wise and based on the fact that we felt like we had everything we needed here. They offer WiFi as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary Heading: Girls trip to OC Tavern to see Keith Harlin in concert
Summary: This small retro motor court is soooo cute. It has a beachy feel. The rooms are decorated differently, very eclectic. The rooms are small but comfortable. Location was great for us. We went to The OC Tavern, just a couple of buildings down. Parked once, were able to walk  there and back. Joyce, the owner, was wonderful. She put up with several text msgs before I made the reservation. She was so nice and accommodating. Safe neighborhood. Parking right at your room door.  I would stay again. Thank you
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, great value road trip stopover
Summary: We stopped in for one night on our way from San Diego to Ventura, and ended up staying two. Really clean and comfortable, absolutely lovely management, and great value. Lots of delicious restaurants, cafes and pubs within walking distance, and easy drive to Trestles and Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary Heading: Short road trip from San Diego to LA
Summary: We stayed one night in #9, a NY themed room and loved it! Great bed, large tv, good AC. I love drive up to your room motels and The Inn is great! No road noise, friendly owners. We'll stay again and recommend it to friends!  From the road it's appealing and well worth the low/mid price.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary: The Inn at Calafia Beach is a great value for the area. It has no frills however is clean, neat and convenient. It is on the main street, Camino Real, so you have to drive to get to almost anything however it does have free off-street parking.  I would recommend it for the budget conscious traveler.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary: This motel is run very well, privately owned by a very nice couple. I drove by liked the look so I went into the office asked to see a room before booking. Room was adorable and perfect for me, I got the "flower room" #13. Rooms have A/C, nice refrigerators, flat screen TV, tile floors. I am a female traveling alone visiting friends in town and felt very safe here. Will definitely come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary: San Clemente is an expensive city especially during the warm vacation months. Traffic, tourists, and oh so many cars. Did I mention expensive?  That said, the Inn at Calafia Beach is more than a bargain. An older inn, the owners have upgraded much of it and appear to still be improving the facility. My room (16) was small but clean. I was traveling by bicycle and staying for a single night, so all I really needed was a bed, a bathroom, and a shower. It gave me that and more for about 1/3 of what many of the larger inns cost.  It's of the older U-shaped design, and in the middle of the courtyard they've provided a nice little seating area. There was a ceiling fan and wall mounted air conditioner. My only complaints would be the small stall shower and the old towels, but as I

Summary: Less than five minutes from the San Clemente State Beach, sits the Inn at Calafia Beach. Very hip, clean, affordable and a friendly staff. Everything water is theme, with each room decorated from wild and crazy to subdued. Close to downtown (everything is walkable!) and all the great restaurants and bars. Worth every dollar spent!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary Heading: Quaint Hotel with a touch of "hip"..Very clean - Very nice staff! Affordable!!
Summary: I was only in San Clemente for the weekend and this hotel was perfect for me. It's a motel without the "motel feel". Loved the hardwood floors and the design of the room. It was simple and basic -  nothing extra fancy or over the top. Price was just right. I was very comfortable there. Quick Uber or taxi to bars, restaurants and the beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary: This place is adorable! Pleasantly surprised to see each room is decorated so neat all having its own theme.It has a very quaint and home like feel. If ever in the area, I will be coming back to the inn at calafia to stay:).  The owners are so kind. Thanks for a wonderful stay and for the birthday cake:).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary Heading: Best Motel we have ever been, High recommended !
Summary: Really cozy and nice motel, well located, reasonably priced. The room was very confortable in every way. All the rooms were really big,special, clean and very nice. The owners were very helpful in advise on what to do in the city. High recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us positive and encouraging feedback.

Summary: Very very reasonably priced, nice rooms, clean and well done!  The owners were welcoming and sweet.  We didn't realized until the morning that they had coffee in the central area.  Oh well.  For $70/night, a real deal!

Summary Heading: Clean, Friendly but Dont Go by The Pictures
Summary: I really want to rate this motel higher based on the friendliness of the owners, however we made the reservation based on the pictures of the inside of the rooms and these pictures lie.  This is an old beach motel that has been repainted inside and out.    Pros New bed, sink, toilet (although ours was broken and glued).  Very clean Ceiling fan Price was cheap although THIS IS THE DELUXE ROOM??? A few cute wall plaques  Cons Room was tiny maybe 10x10 and all beige 2 ft by 2 ft tile which gave it a rather cold look.   No real furniture - bed and two small side tables Fold up table and chairs suitable for under 60 lbs or small child - not functional No rugs  2 small towels.  They were threadbare and you could see through them Soap was horrible and unusable  So, sound awful right?

Everything about this place was fine.  I had read some bad reviews, so I was a little apprehensive, but booked it anyway because it was economical and convenient.  It turned out to be very nice as a basic overnight.  Check-in was friendly, the room was clean and attractive with some nice touches, and everything worked.  I'd stay here again for sure.

We stayed at the Inn at Calafia Beach for our friends wedding at the country club. It was very close, super clean rooms, and exceptional service. The people who run the place are unbelievably friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again. :)

Summary Heading: All reservations prior to July 2014 LOST
Summary: So I just called 949-492-1174 to confirm a reservation I made in May 2014, and was informed that anything 2 months or older was not being honored by the new management, including vouchers, etc.   Initially I called the hotel directly and made a reservation over the phone. Today the front desk said whomever I talked to, was gone. She had zero reservations for the that week in september,(2.5 weeks from today) she didn't even ask what night.. Lol.  Think we all should count on something more reliable.. goodness..

loved how the new management has redone the rooms, very cozy motel and a very hard working manager. price is worth it for the location near the beach. was very happy about the stay. definitely recommend it

This hotel (I wouldn't even call it that) has the worst management known to mankind. They do not answer their phones, they constantly are changing ownership and taking it on their customers, and they are losing or throwing away reservations because they feel like it. I will never go back to this place and I am warning people to not waste your money - there are so many other hotels/motels that are better and in the same area.... THIS PLACE IS THE WORST.

SERIOUSLY???? Our daughter bought us a Living Social weekend and that is the best thing I can say about this deal. That she bought us a gift because she is wonderful.  We arrived and the parking lot was filled with what appeared to be crack heads - keep in mind this IS NOT a destination for families, people past the age of 30 or senior citizens. Don't expect too much from this place, but it wasn't as horrible as some of the previous reviews.  I booked us a 3 night stay over Labor Day Weekend.  I looked at older reviews and found that many had loved this place.  More recent reviews, were not so positive.  But, I gave it a shot, because the price was right.  Overall, it worked out well.  We only used our room to sleep.  There is so much to do around here and the weather is perfect!  We just spent our days outside of the hotel enjoying the beaches, farmers market, restaurants and nearby cities.  The pros:  The location is perfect!  Close to everything San Clemente has to offer and the freeway.  The price.  Its hard to find anything in the area under $100/night.  Our room decor.  We enjoyed the artwork and the table lamps,

We purchased a two night, two bedroom Groupon coupon and stayed here May 10-12. After spending a long day at the San Diego Zoo, we just wanted a shower and a quick nap before dinner with our relatives. When I went to check in, the young man behind the glass partition said he would open the door for us since housekeeping had misplaced the key, no problem...except when we walked into the room it was stuffy and smelled like smoke! Young man apologized and said, "some people don't follow the rules, we tried to get the smell out as best we could, let me buy you a bottle of wine."  As he turned to walk away we opened the refrigerator to turn it on so  the baby's sippy cups would stay cold...blahhhh! A horrible odor came pouring out and inside was a dirty damp towel! Again the young

Summary Heading: Something out of a horror movie
Summary: My son purchased a two night stay at this hotel for me and my husband for Christmas.  We booked our trip and proceeded to drive two hours to the destination.  Upon arrival the desk clerk gave us our room key, told us we would be moved to a better room tomorrow, and told us the manager would buy us a bottle of wine.  The deal supposedly came with a bottle of wine already.  We proceeded to our room which was something out of a horror movie.  Reeked of cigarette smoke, carpet looked like someone changed their oil on it, bathroom shower curtain was covered with pink mildew, screens were falling off the window,  scratch marks inside the door (I guess they have to lock their guests in to get them to stay) headboard, and tables were dirty with age, and there were two full sized beds
Manager Response: I deeply apologize about the issues you had here.  Unfortunately what actually happened was that we had over booked due to a flood of people making reservations before the Living Social expiration.  We have a lot of returning guests who love staying here because of the cleanliness and the service.  The bottle of wine meant that we would get you an extra bottle on top of the already provided bottle.  My dog is never left unattended and he is always on a leash and sometimes enjoys being outside.  He is a puppy and the guests here love to play and hang out with him. Again I am sorry about your experience but this is not somewhere where we have to "lock the guests in the rooms". The room you were in is the last room we ever give out and usually for walk-ins only.  The guests before you had smoked in there which is not allowed and they were charged. As I previously stated, we had overbooked and just tried to make it work for you.  Very sorry for your experience, but I can assure you that this review does not properly explain what we actually have here.

Summary: Overall, my 2 stays here have not disappointed. Dana, the owner and management is excellent! Greets you with a smile and is SUPER personable.  Retro surf motel with a quirky vibe is the theme. Basic rooms  with clean linen and bath.  The small fridge and microwave are good additions. About 2 miles from the beach! Loved that Hapa J's is a short walk away - a must try for Hawaiian fusion food and Kona Brewing Co. beer!  Happy with our stay in San Clemente. Will return again.

Summary Heading: Good value - and a classic surf motel
Summary: This place is great value, and the rooms were recently redecorated, so they aren't as old and dusty as some places in the same price bracket. We enjoyed our 3 days here! There's a BBQ area and some basic kitchen equipment, which means it's easy to stay here and self-cater, if you're on a budget, or else there are loads of places to eat nearby.

I was a little skeptical as drove in, but once in the room, I found the room very clean, recently painted and nicely furnished. I was given a bottle of wine and a $25 gift certificate for a local restaurant, ( didn't get a chance to use it this trip). The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's a surf motel. If your looking for a full service Hotel, this isn't it, but I was there visiting friends and just needed a clean place to sleep, and for $60 a night, I think I got more than my monies worth. Will use again the next time I go there.

As we drove in the first impression was “this does not look good” We checked in, took a look at the room & the grounds & checked out.  It is a low income run of the mill motel. Description was totally oversold.   They advertise as clean & crisp for a good night’s sleep.    Not so. I would have been afraid to put my head down on the pillow.  The bed-covers were not very clean & the entire establishment was very un-kept.  The adorable court yard was nothing of the kind. The office was uninviting with the manager behind glass speaking thru a hole & a hole for a pass through.  Now, does that sound like a safe neighborhood?
Manager Response: We are very sorry you didn't find our modest little surf motel didn't meet your standards.  It is just that though, a small surf motel which it is also advertised as. Our towel sets, bed sheets, pillow cases and comforters are washed on a daily basis and are ALWAYS changed before our next guests arrive. If there was a pillow case you needed because the ones you saw didn't seem clean, I would have gladly assissted with that.  I always go above and beyond for our guests and it has left us with good reviews and happy guests.  I must say that this motel just isn't for some people.  As far as the neighborhood, it is very safe and a very friendly and mellow little surf town. Our courtyard area is a grass area with a firepit, a covered kitchen with a gas grill, and two tables and some chairs. There are pictures on our website and thats all it is. A simple sitting area that our guests have always enjoyed. It always becomes a little social gathering around the fire and a great place to watch the sunset over the ocean. The glass window at our front desk does not reflect the neighborhood or the people that live and work around here.  It is very safe.  For the prices we offer and the service we provide you will absolutely get everything you paid for and even more.  Again we are sorry you didn't choose to stay with us and we will do everything we can so this situation does not happen again.  -Management

Summary Heading: Good Vibes Good Price Good Place
Summary: I stayed there for 9 days and it was a great experience! very comfortable, quite yet close to Downtown San Clamente (3min drive from Ave. Del Mar (downtown main st.) Staff are SUPER AMAZING! Helpful, kind, friendly, wonderful vibe! If i go back to San Clamente, i would definatelly stay there again! It had everything i needed!  Fast WiFi, Clean, comfortble, very beautiful outdoor kitchen & BBQ, with patio area and fire pit. Excellent way to cook your dinner while watching the sun setting.  5min drive from the Calafia beach.Free Parking. 2min drive from Ralph's Grocery store, 1min drive from Hwy 5.  Wonderful place to stay! Higly recommend! :-)

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I have been in my entire life!
Summary: The room was dirty, everything was filthy and bugs were walking on the floor of the bathroom..  Need to be a magician to set up the basic things in the bathroom.  No A/C!  Need to leave the door open to ventilate the room. Hospitality was excellent.  A new manager called Collin, that was really trying. However, the housekeeper forgot to clean the room.........Oooop!

We stayed here for 2 nights during a surf vacation.  It was a great location for driving to San Onofre to surf, or to Del Mar for dinner and drinks at night in San Clemente.  It's definitely an old-school style motel with parking right out front and small rooms in single story building, just off the main road.  But we loved it - we got the "retro" room and it was really all we needed - a bed, extra table and chairs, bathroom/shower, in-room fridge (important!) and TV.  Although the door opened right into the parking lot and then to busy street, we always felt safe.  It was unseasonably hot when we were staying (85 plus degrees), but the ceiling fan worked great.  There's a little communal garden area in the middle of the parking lot that we didn't use but other guests were.  If

Yes,  it is sort of retro and quirky but basically a very small room without adequate ventilation and the smell of old.  It was clean but not really.  The headboard in the "2nd" bedroom (actually just a very large closet full of a bed) was filthy and stained and grossed us out.  Also the carpet was stained and dirty and just left you with an unclean feeling.  The bed was uncomfortable and the pillows worthless.

Summary Heading: Not What It Says It Is
Summary: Arriving At the Inn at Calafia Beach on Auust 31, it was quite warm.Shocked to discover there was no air conditioning I told the manager ,Dana, that it was impossible to sleep in such a hot room.Her response was that I just had to deal with it and keep the windows open. I am a single woman traveling alone and felt it was unsafe to sleep in a room with open windows and without telephones in case of emergency.I have traveled extensively and have stayed in many "dives" but this place takes the cake!

Summary Heading: Love the quirky rooms and proximity to Trestles!
Summary: We stayed 3 days at the Inn on our road trip along the Californian coast - specifically in San Clemente as my husband wanted to surf the Trestles.  After reading bunch of reviews on tripadvisor we found this Inn and luckily they had still a room available (we literally called 5 minutes before we wanted to check in).   The rooms are very basic but quirky, each room is different, some with funny art and little details. There's no AC but the vents are fine; the rooms are clean and you can park right in front of the door. There's a medium size fridge in the room which came handy for me to keep the wine cool :). There's a small BBQ kitchen should you want to cook. There's a little noise from the traffic but it's bearable.  Dana, the owner of the Inn is so helpful and friendly, it

Summary Heading: Fun Retro Hotel with A Fab Manager!
Summary: Dragged the husband to a beach trip for his birthday...(yes, it's his b-day, but I needed the trip!). Looked into San Clemente after a recommendation from a colleague who said we'd "love it!"   Hotels weren't easy to find--lots were booked up & ones that only looked mildly swanky were over-priced. So, with so many great reviews on TripAdvisor, I booked the Inn at Calafia Beach.   Reviewers were right on the money: cool retro motel feel, super clean, close to most everything (we walked to & from the beach twice a day), and Dana, the manager was fantastic!   Massive kudos to Dana for remembering it was the husband's b-day & presenting him with a $25 gift card to a nice restaurant downtown. She also gave us lots of suggestions on other restaurants, beaches, and fun tourist stuff!

we showed up 30 minutes early for check in,our room was ready.dana was wonderful she was patient.even though i had more ppl in my party than she was aware of she was still helpful.the room was clean and cute. it wasa 2 bedroom and there was plenty of room for 4 kids and 3 adults.beds were comfortable and clean.the breeze from the nearby ocean was great and kept our room cool. the outdoor cooking area was nice and had everything u needed to cook with.they even provided some seasonings.there was a laundry room that was reasonable,and since we had little kids that was great.there was a fridge in the room which was big enough for us to store eggs,sausage,milk,juice in.dana even gave us some ice instead of making us walk to store.parking was tight but we had a suv which we were able

A throw back to the sixties, the Inn At Calafia in San Clemente is sure to delight those travelers looking for a fun get away to this beach side community.  Whether it's a day trip to Disneyland or a sunny afternoon at the beach, the Inn At Calafia provides the perfect place to make your escape from the grind a soothing reality.  What are you waiting for???  Go have some fun!!!

i feel badly writing this, the woman at the office was very nice but i am pretty disappointed with this place and i've only been here since 5 p.m. i was really looking forward to staying here based on the reviews i read on tripadvisor. the location is really good, super-close to downtown san clemente, it's inexpensive and they have a little grill/picnic area which is convenient. i understand you pay for what you get, but i would at least expect the money i put up for a 2-night stay to afford me a toilet bowl seat. seriously, there is NO seat on this thing. the sink counter is dirty/sticky and appears to not have been wiped down. the noise from el camino real is so loud i may as well have the room door open. as stated in other reviews, there is no a/c. this wouldn't normally
Manager Response: Dear Kara- I am SO sorry!   I left you a voicemail yesterday morning, when I realized our agregious mistake.   My housekeeper had told me about needing to replace the toilet seat and it completely slipped my mind. That was a horrific thing to have slip my mind. I only wish you had come up to the office to let me know and I would have taken care of it immediately. I was mortified when my housekeeper asked if I had remembered to replace the seat and ran right to your room and knocked, you had already left, that is when I called you.  I can only, wholeheartedly, apologize about the lack of toilet seat. That is certainly not a frill or amenity that you should have to ask about when making reservations. I assure you, the toilets have seats (when I am not having a brain freeze!)  The courtyard rules are that the guests be in and fire out by 11:30, the guests were compliant that evening.    I completely understand your discontent and am, again, very sorry. If you had let me know, rather than suffering through without a toilet seat, I assure you I would have taken care of it. Reviews are really helpful and I appreciate you taking the time- but I so wish you had just come to the office to let me know, prior to writing a review about things that you didn't give me the chance to fix.  I am guessing you don't have interest in staying with us again, but if that changes, I will be happy to offer you two complimentary nights in the future. Unfortunately El Camino is a busy street until around 10PM, after that it does quiet down. I hope the rest of your trip was more enjoyable and certainly, less confusing!  Feel free to contact me directly. Best, Dana

Summary Heading: Great Place, Great Owner, GREAT PRICE!
Summary: Dana saved us from the La Vista Inn down the street.  We stayed there one night and I was going to sleep in the car rather than stay there again.  She was so nice and friendly.  The rooms are cute and clean!  The place just feels good and has a good vibe to it.  It is also close to lots of great restaurants and bars, and the place itself is very well thought out and has a lot of nice extras for the price.  There are bike rentals and a really cool cabana in the center with a full kitchen that you can use.  There is a grill and fire pit, too.  Plus, an outdoor shower!  If you surf or spend time at the beach, you really appreciate those outdoor showers for washing sand off your feet and cleaning up your gear.  For as cute as this place is and as nice and friendly as the owner is

Decided to stay the night after our family Christmas eve gathering in San Clemente. We'd been driving from vacation in Tahoe and after 8 hours in the car, were thankful for the comfortable bed. Spending Christmas eve here is becoming as much a tradition as visiting family in San Clemente. Compared to other options around, this is the best place to stay for comfort and budget. Dana, the owner, is super helpful and thoughtful-- even remembered us from last year. Ask for the Zen room-- or other 2 bedroom unit if you're traveling with family or like privacy traveling with a friend. Some improved shower and newer bathroom in the Zen room-- compared to the shower we had last year. Of course we will be back next year-- and with a new baby to join us!

Summary Heading: Best inn I've ever been so far
Summary: The rooms are nice and clean, the location is safe and quiet.  I stayed in the Shaggy room, it was very comfortable and clean, the bathroom was fine and there was plenty of space in the room. The lady at the front desk is really nice and welcoming, the service is really good. I absolutely recommend it, the price is beyond fair.  I stayed in many motels and inns during my road trip in California and this is the best one I stayed in. I wish they were all like this.

I love this little inn.  The rooms are adorable!  My girls and I stayed in a 2 bedroom and they said it was there favorite hotel ever (funny because we stay a lot of really nice luxury places that cost a lot of money - had I known they would be so happy here I would have saved a ton of money!).  The beds are comfortable, it felt very clean and safe and the girl who runs it is so nice.  We walked up the street and got tacos every day and there is a great beach a short drive away.  I would recommend it to Mom's that need a break or families with small kids that don't want to spend a fortune for 2 rooms.  It is charming - I would also think it would be so fun to rent the whole place for a family reunion or girls weekend!

Summary Heading: Charming, friendly staff, but more "motel" than "inn"
Summary: This is a cute place. The staff was very friendly and greeted me with a glass of wine after a long day of traveling. The BBQ area in the middle of the property was very nice to hang out and enjoy the sunshine. It is cheap, but you get what you paid for. When I walked in to the room, two rather large crickets greeted me in my room. The room was clean, but by no means fancy at all. If beach motel is what you're going for and you just need a cheap bed for the night, then this place is great.

We loved the outdoor bbq area even though we didn't bbq. Sat out there and drank a glass of wine with my sweetie and less than 30 feet from our room. Felt kinda like a Melrose type place. The gal at the front desk was super nice and friendly - I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Vintage charm and a bargain to boot
Summary: I was in San Clemente for just one night doing some photography.  I didn't want nor need the ammenities of a larger chain but at the same time as a woman traveling solo, I didn't want to sacrafice safety. The Inn satisfied my needs.    The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and gave me a "small town" feel.  Where else can you check in and be told "the gal that handles the checkin's is out but here is the key to your room; when you see her car return you can come to the office and pay".    The Inn itself is vintage with only 16 bungalows and I personally liked that part. I appreciate the feel of an old fashioned "motor court".  The room was extremely clean and well kept. As a journalist I generally reserve writing for newspaper and magazines however this being my first trip advisor review, and while reflecting over the last few days, I felt it needful to share and give an honest appraisal of my recent experience at the Inn at Calafia Beach motel.    As someone who travels a lot there’re a few basic things one hopes to find in a motel, air conditioning, cleanliness, respectful neighbors and an overall common sense approach by owners of a facility like this towards its customers. As I was bringing our luggage in I heard her shrieking from the bathroom, I raced in to investigate and found her pressed hard into the corner trying to avoid being scalded

Summary Heading: We were disappointed. almost ruined our weekend
Summary: After seeing the great reviews here we were very excited to stay at this little retro hotel. Please know that this is a budget hotel with NO A/C. It is right on a busy street.  Unfortunately our experience was not that great. Dana, the manager was very accommodating. top marks for service. She gave us our choice of rooms and we picked one we thought would be cooler and quieter. I prepared to take a shower, turned the faucet to hot and went to turn it down when the faucet handle fell off, apart in my hand, and began to disinegrate. I was unable to turn off the scalding hot water but fortunately did not burn myself. Dana graciously moved us to a large, two bedroom suite. Summary Heading: Friendly, good value and very sweet
Summary: The Inn at Calafia Beach was our first stop on a 2 week journey through California, and we couldn't have asked for more. Very sweet, themed rooms greet the weary traveller, with a comfortable bed, well maintained facilities, and within a stones throw from shopping, the beach and some excellent dining.  Dana runs the Inn, and we found her advice and assistance invaluable. She helped us find supermarkets, parking, beach access and restaurant options, all with a huge smile and a laugh. Very well received by two bewildered Australians on their first trip to the US!  There are very well priced laundry facilities on site, a BBQ area and bikes for hire. Lots of parking. The room rates are exceptionally well priced.  When we inevitably return to SoCal, we'll be staying here again

This was the first stop for our family on a cross country trip to new York. We were pleasantly surprised when we pulled up. It isn't anything fancy, so if you are looking for that type of hotel, this isn't for you. It was clean and Dana was wonderful. She lives at the hotel and can tell that she does whatever she can to make the stay pleasurable. The only thing that I would say is the bed in the Zen room was a little hard. My kids bed was super comfortable and woke up saying how well they slept. I would recommend this hotel to anyone of our friends!
This Is the perfect surf inn. We stayed for one night and it was very Comfy. We stayed in the japan/china room.the bed was a little stiff but it was overall great

Summary Heading: Perfect place for a leisurely weekend with teens!
Summary: Free Wi-Fi, Free Cable/HBO Hooked up outdoor grilling area! Beach Cruisers, surf boards Outdoor shower Great location, centrally located in San Diego County. Next door to a great restaurant/sports bar we tried and recommend: OC Tavern (great food!)

You know how you always want to find that hidden gem? That perfect getaway? The one you will return to over and over? Well, this is it!  My husband and I are in love with this place.  The Innkeeper, Dana, is the best of the best! We were led to the gorgeous, fun and playful Shag Room. It puts the shag in shagadelic! Yes, it's fun, but it's also super comfortable! This room is  actually two rooms, both with comfy beds, perfect pillows, a flat screen and FREE Wi-Fi!  Also a fridge, fab powerful shower, and a sitting area that's perfect for relaxing with your coffee in the morning. So convenient - the coffee and coffee maker are furnished, so you don't have to run, half awake, to the nearest coffee house when your feet hit the floor upon waking. The INN is a throwback to the typical surfer Motel.  Like the ones you picture Endless Summer cast & crew staying.  The Manager lives on site which speaks to the "ownership" of the property!  Communication with the manager, Dana, and the staff was easy and professional.  Room was clean comfortable and very cute!  There are standard rooms but I stayed in one of the themed rooms for fun.  I was in the Retro room but there are two other very cute ones (the manager showed me all three)! The room was actually a two room set up and had many amenities and a large screen T.V!  There is a cute courtyard for grilling and hanging out. The beach is a quick bike ride away! (You could walk too).There are restaurants and stores in walking distance. Summary Heading: Cool spot for a quick trip
Summary: Great little hotel. Right off the freeway, which makes it easy to find. We drove down to the beach and explored the downtown area, which is very close. There is a golf course behind the hotel so not a lot of noise at night. Huge flatscreen tv's, we didn't have time to watch tv, but there were loads of channels to pick from. Cool, modern layout in the 'retro room', no tubs in the bathroom if you're looking for a soak, but the shower works just fine even though it's a little dated. Bed was nice and firm and lots of fluffy pillows. We travel to San Clemente every year for Christmas eve, and would love to go back to this place next year. There is free parking just outside your room, and I wish we had brought the computer, because there is free wifi also. Hotel feels comfortable,

I stayed there during a weekend. We booked retro room for 1 night. Room feature includes: flat screen TV, refrigerator, free wireless internet, coffee maker and HBO. The mattress was kinda hard. I like new design of the room BUT huge disappointed at bathroom. Apparently they didn't remodel bathroom at all. It has pink/ red nasty looking old tiles, especially shower stall. Shower curtain has mold all over it, and also shower head didn't work properly (few water came out and it pokes the skin badly). Also the light in front of our room was so bright that inturrupted our sleep. Moreover we couldn't sleep well at all since our neighbor were so drunk and they hung out in front of our room until 4 am in the morning. It was terrible experience. Dana was amazing, she set us up in the Shag room with a flat screen, two bed rooms, and a very luxurious feel.  She was extremely accomodating, providing us with ice for our cooler and giving us a  GREAT rate on the room. She also helped us navigate our way into LA.. After being on the road for 6 days, it was a relief  to have such a wonderful experience in such a cool place. Thanks again, Dana!

Summary Heading: Way better than others in San Clemente
Summary: We come to San Clemente often and have stayed at many places and I can say thus far this place is awesome. Definatey cleaned up since Nike took over apparently. Stayed in a "theme" room called Retro and it was so unique - Bed was a little low but great price!! We plan on coming back and staying again! Don't let this one fool you my friends!!!

Summary Heading: there's no room like the shag room!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Summary: went to san clemente to surf lower trestles and thought I'd check out nike's "no tell motel"......... the "motel no tell" was gone and the inn at calafia beach stands in the aftermath of nike's summer party motel............. missed it, [--], disappointed that nike was gone but thought I'd check it out.... this place is GREAT; retro, shag and zen rooms......... you have to see it ....... stayed the weekend and had a blast......... the oc tavern next door......ITS ALL GOOD............

Things are much improved at the motel, they have refurbished the rooms and the staff.  The style is more classic motel, nothing too fancy here. It's a casual place to stay with easy access to the OC Tavern, a quick bike ride to the ocean.  The communal hangout/seating area is a good place to meet other travelers, also has a BBQ and stove for a weekend cookout. I looked at a few rooms, and they all seem to be a little different, so ask for a quick tour.  Golf course right behind the building, but I didn't investigate it.
